Message.Msg: "Infosys says sales down as IBM is taking market share in India. CNBC says IBM moves down in symphony with Infosys declining sales in India." I did not see a statement from INFY or an analyst that IBM was taking business. Where can I find it?

I like the sentiment but EPS of $4 would be by far the biggest blowout in IBM history. They earned $2.78 Operating EPS for Q1 2012 and the composite analyst estimate on Yahoo for Q1 2013 is $3.05 or up 9.7%. I think that's low and it could be more like $3.14 or up 13%. Were you thinking of Q2? That one should be in the $4 range.

Message.Title: Market today --- buy-the-dip
Message.Msg: This Gold confused everybody today Gold rush is over no need for protection any more

That makes a lot of sense. Cypress is a basket case but it seemed to be absorbed by the money from the IMF & ECB. Slower monthly employment reports will be OK as long as there isn't a string of weak reports. The wild-card is if the US economy stumbles under the Sequester, Obama Care and the possibility of the Fed easing back on purchases to inject cash in banks. I didn't like the weak mortgage lending of a couple of big banks. IBM is back to being named the tech bellwether again. That's probably because DELL, HPQ and ORCL have converged on IBM's model. But none have built IBM's base that produces about 75% of annual revenue from backlog existing at the beginning of the year. Let's hope IBM continues to see margin improvement and strong software revenue.

Message.Title: p1sorell replaced by spcrash.
Message.Msg: Gag me. Just when I thought this Board had potential. Probably one in the same.

I liked the other guy better. Big Blue is doing better than the DOW so far. We'll see how the market looks into the close. I believe Buffett has been adding about 1 mil shares per Q. So IBM is buying about 1 of 20 shares traded. Buffett no doubt has staff overseeing IBM accumulation along guidelines approved by Buffett. He seems to be using IBM's buyback % as a guideline for adding to his own position which went up around 5% in 2012. You have to expect other long term funds to take the lead from Buffett. It's nice to have the improving IBM accumulation cushion for sell offs.
The hard way? We've got you to tell us all about it, so it's easy ya' d-bag.

Topic.Title: 58% of Americans think that the stock market will drop by more than 30% in the next 12 months

Message.Msg: Those 58% of Americans are collecting "entitlements", food stamps,welfare and etc. and have no knowledge that Wall St. exists.
I don't see this crash guy anymore. Thank God for the 'ignore'.
I got him/her (pissorell) on ignore too I guess. Nice and peaceful and quiete now.
IBM has doubled in five years, and it will do so again. Will it correct and trade down to $180? Maybe? But, if it does buy it as it is going to $300...
